relation: for fun i go to the gym because it gets my mind off of things and keeps me focused.

the dining is either a win or lose. if you are a picky eater like i am it is harder for you to enjoy the food because you most likely will not like the food. they do have a huge selection of what you can eat and drink.
as a freshman, so far the dorming has been fantastic. i like the ways that the rooms are set up and i enjoy the environment.
this school has very good academic ways, and they are good at the way the create their syllabus.

all i would have to say is to make sure that you keep a positive attitude with all the work that you do. also, make sure that if you are struggling you ask a professor for help because if not you will struggle. they are lenient and will work with you and your schedule.

the professors are considerate and encourage you to do you best. the professors don't give you an absurd amount of work. the people on campus are friendly and majority of the time easy to get along with.
pageTitle: York College Pennsylvania Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {78317=Johnson dining hall was just re-amped with a new look and feel. It's going to be a great place to eat during the 2014-2015 academic year., 7135=The education I am receiving here is excellent, York College was ranked number 13 among the best regional colleges in the North by U.S News 2011 Best College's Edition. For a private college, York is extremely affordable., 295589=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 73255=My favorite teacher stayed in my dorm complex around 1995, so the complex I'm in is a little worn, but definitely a lot better than other college's I visited my senior year. But once you become an upperclassmen there are so many other great options for you!, 156771=Apply early. They offer an application that can be sent in during the Summer of your junior year in high school. It is a great opportunity to get information earlier and be able to meet with prospective professors. For example, I sent my 2012 application in August 2011 and received information in October 2011. I was able to meet with my professors from my major and I had already received my application status saying I was accepted. You do not have to accept the acceptance letter at that time., 141969=not big partiers. Students to like classrooms with a ratio of 1:18 or at most 20. Students that like a sense of belonging to a small community., 113305=There is a wide variety of clubs on campus. There are clubs for majors, causes, religions, and just for fun. They have something for everyone's desires. We also have a wide variety of sports, but no football team. We like to say undefeated since 1787 because we've never had one at all.}
textBeforeTable: 01/16/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 16 out of 16 people found this review useful. 1 of 68 Hilary from West Deptford, NJ Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Great for these types of students Anybody that likes a small but serious atmosphere. Tips for prospective students Make sure your work comes first, and you will be just fine. You shouldn't be here if you're not serious. Bang for the buck You are not paying a lot to be here but you are definately getting your monies worth. It's a wonderful learning environment and you are sure to have a blast. Am enjoying being here There is always something to do around campus. Concerts, Relay for Life, club sports, collegiate sports, a brand new, amazing workout center complete with rock climbing wall. Not to mention the fraternities and sororities which are always doing something. Am learning a lot I have learned so much in my first three semesters here. The classes are generally small, so there is great professor/student ratio's. They are amusing and easy to get along with and are always willing to help. And the Learning Resource Center is always available if you are ever in need of extra assistance. Login to rate or flag the reviews
